page.title: 19Meltham Mills and Co-op
page.content:
{ Meltham}grew up around the{woollen {mills}because the water ran over the peat on the moors . At one time in the{1800's}there were{woollen mills, {cotton mills}and{silk mills}in {Meltham.}Today only a few of the{mills remain working. Some of the{mills stand unused, falling into ruins but some are being used _as{store houses and one is even being used as a {brewery.
{Meltham Mills Co-operative Society} {Meltham Mills Co-op}was started in {1828}to provide cheaper food for the{mill}workers.It is meant to be the first{co-op}in{Britain,}but no records were kept, so people think{Rochdale {Co-op}was the first, because they kept records.The only{co-op}now in{Meltham is the{supermarket}in{Huddersfield {Road.
